content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: AESER
      operator: not_equal_to
      value: N
    - all:
        - any:
            - name: AESCAN
              operator: not_exists
            - name: AESCAN
              operator: not_equal_to
              value: Y
        - any:
            - name: AESCONG
              operator: not_exists
            - name: AESCONG
              operator: not_equal_to
              value: Y
        - any:
            - name: AESDISAB
              operator: not_exists
            - name: AESDISAB
              operator: not_equal_to
              value: Y
        - any:
            - name: AESDTH
              operator: not_exists
            - name: AESDTH
              operator: not_equal_to
              value: Y
        - any:
            - name: AESHOSP
              operator: not_exists
            - name: AESHOSP
              operator: not_equal_to
              value: Y
        - any:
            - name: AESLIFE
              operator: not_exists
            - name: AESLIFE
              operator: not_equal_to
              value: Y
        - any:
            - name: AESOD
              operator: not_exists
            - name: AESOD
              operator: not_equal_to
              value: Y
        - any:
            - name: AESMIE
              operator: not_exists
            - name: AESMIE
              operator: not_equal_to
              value: Y
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SDTMIG.CG0042
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Select record where AESCAN and AESCONG and AESDISAB and AESDTH and AESHOSP
  and AESLIFE and AESOD and AESMIE ^= "Y" However, AESER ^= "N"
Outcome:
  Message: If AESER = "N" then none of the seriousness criteria (AESCAN, AESCONG,
    AESDISAB, AESDTH, AESHOSP, AESLIFE, AESOD, AESMIE) could be equal to "Y".
  Output Variables:
    - AESER
    - AESCAN
    - AESCONG
    - AESDISAB
    - AESDTH
    - AESHOSP
    - AESLIFE
    - AESOD
    - AESMIE
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0042
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: "If categories of serious events are collected secondarily\
                  \ to a leading question, as in the example below,  the values of\
                  \ the variables that capture reasons an event is considered serious\
                  \ (i.e., AESCAN, AESCONG, etc.) may be null.  For example, if Serious\
                  \ = \"No\", the values for these variables may be null. However,\
                  \ if Serious = \"Yes\", at least one of them will have a \"Y\" response.\n\
                  \n\n    "
                Document: IG v3.4
                Item: Assumption 6a
                Section: 6.2.1
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - EVENTS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - AE

json.Description: Select record where AESCAN and AESCONG and AESDISAB and AESDTH and AESHOSP and AESLIFE and AESOD and AESMIE ^= "Y" However, AESER ^= "N"

Outcome.Message: If AESER = "N" then none of the seriousness criteria (AESCAN, AESCONG, AESDISAB, AESDTH, AESHOSP, AESLIFE, AESOD, AESMIE) could be equal to "Y".

Citations.Cited_Guidance: If categories of serious events are collected secondarily to a leading question, as in the example below,  the values of the variables that capture reasons an event is considered serious (i.e., AESCAN, AESCONG, etc.) may be null.  For example, if Serious = "No", the values for these variables may be null. However, if Serious = "Yes", at least one of them will have a "Y" response.
